title: Exhaust Intermediate and Header Pipes - Installation

body.body: Exhaust Intermediate and Header Pipes - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
If removed, apply a thin smear of anti-seize compound to the threads of the oxygen sensor, install the oxygen sensor and tighten to
If removed refit the finned clamps to the exhaust header pipes,
Fit new gaskets to the exhaust balance pipe and fit it to one of the exhaust header pipes.
Fit a new exhaust gasket and the flanged sleeve to the exhaust intermediate pipe port on the catalytic converter.
If removed, apply a thin smear of anti-seize compound to the threads of the clamp and fit to the exhaust intermediate pipe port on the catalytic converter. Do not tighten the clamp.
To retain the gaskets during assembly, apply a smear of grease or petroleum jelly to the gasket faces in the cylinder head.
Fit new gaskets to the cylinder head ports.

body.name: Header pipe to cyl head gasket cjcu

body.body: Apply a proprietary high temperature grease to the exhaust header pipe studs on the cylinder head.

Locate the exhaust header pipe, with the exhaust balance pipe, to the cylinder head, ensure the gasket does not become displaced during assembly. Fit the fixings to the cylinder head studs but do not fully tighten at this stage.
Attach the exhaust header pipe to the catalytic converter, do not tighten the clamp at this stage.
Locate the other exhaust header pipe to the cylinder head while also aligning it to the exhaust balance pipe. Fit the fixings to the cylinder head studs but do not fully tighten at this stage.
Attach the exhaust header pipe to the catalytic converter, do not tighten the clamp at this stage.
Tighten the exhaust header to cylinder head fixings in the sequence shown below.
Exhaust Header Nuts Tightening Sequence - D Series
Tighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (1) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe upper nut (2) to
Retighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (1) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (3) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe upper nut (4) to
Retighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (3) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe to cylinder head nuts in the sequence shown below:
Tighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (1) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe upper nut (2) to
Retighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (1) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (3) to
Tighten the exhaust header pipe upper nut (4) to
Retighten the exhaust header pipe lower nut (3) to
Align the header pipe to catalytic converter pipe clamps so that the compression slots are equally spaced to both sides of the clamps.
Tighten the exhaust header to catalytic converter clamp to
Tighten the exhaust balance pipe clamps to
Route the oxygen sensor harness as noted for removal and connect to the main harness as noted for removal.
Attach the exhaust intermediate pipe to the catalytic converter, ensure the anti-rotation rod is placed between the two halves of the clamp. Do not tighten the clamp at this stage.

body.name: intermediate pipe to cat converter anti rotation cjcy

body.body: Fit the exhaust silencer (if a single seat is fitted, see
Exhaust Silencer - Installation - with Single Seat
Left hand intermediate exhaust pipe only:
Secure the intermediate exhaust pipe to the frame and tighten the fixing to
Tighten the exhaust intermediate pipe to catalytic converter clamp to
Fit the exhaust cover and tighten its fixing to
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first (see
Start the engine and check for exhaust gas leaks. Rectify if necessary.
